Title: Microsoft: Study Proves Investing in 'DevEx' Pays Off -- Visual Studio Magazine
Description: Microsoft says organizational focus on improving the overall developer experience -- as opposed to traditional developer productivity/velocity measurements -- pays off, according to new research.

Title: The ZK update conflict issue in multi-user applications
Description:
I haven't seen much ink being spewed on the ZK update conflict issue so I'll write a short note here.
Let's take a step back. Zero-knowledge proofs allow you to prove the result of the execution of some logic. Like signatures attached to data you receive, ZK proofs can be attached to a computation result. This means that with ZK, internet protocols can be rethought and redesigned. If execution of  ...

Title: Zero-knowledge proofs in stateful applications
Description:
Something that might not be immediately obvious if you're not used to zero-knowledgifying your applications, is that the provable circuits you end up using are pure functions. They do not have access to long-lasting memory and cannot have side effects. They just take some input, and produce some output.

Note: circuits are actually not strictly pure, as they are non-deterministic. For example, you ...
